intro: Hermannia tripartita, commonly known as the three-parted hermannia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, oval-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four to five petals. Hermannia tripartita is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices.
